body:
<!-- If you need help or think you have found a bug, please help us with your issue by entering the following information (otherwise you can delete this text): -->

if we can group command like `kubectl`,it will easy to read,like this
```
Release Commands:
  get         download extended information of a named release
  history     fetch release history
  install     install a chart
  list        list releases
  test        run tests for a release
  rollback    roll back a release to a previous revision
  status      displays the status of the named release
  template    locally render templates
  uninstall   uninstall a release
  upgrade     upgrade a release

Chart Commands:
  create      create a new chart with the given name
  dependency  manage a chart's dependencies
  pull        download a chart from a repository and (optionally) unpack it in local directory
  show        show information of a chart
  lint        examines a chart for possible issues
  package     package a chart directory into a chart archive
  repo        add, list, remove, update, and index chart repositories
  search      search for a keyword in charts
  verify      verify that a chart at the given path has been signed and is valid

Other Commands:
  completion  Generate autocompletions script for the specified shell (bash or zsh)
  env         Helm client environment information
  plugin      install, list, or uninstall Helm plugins
  version     print the client version information

Use "helm <command> --help" for more information about a given command.

```
title: should we group command for easy read?
